articles.title: Japanese automaker Nissan says losses deepened in the last quarter
articles.description: TOKYO (AP) — Japanese automaker Nissan reported deeper losses for the latest quarter through December compared to a year earlier, as restructuring costs cut into its profitability. Nissan Motor Corp., based in the port city of Yokohama, said Thursday it posted a 28.3 billion yen ($185 million) loss

articles.title: Europe’s “untouched” wilderness was shaped by Neanderthals and hunter-gatherers
articles.description: Long before agriculture, humans were transforming Europe’s wild landscapes. Advanced simulations show that hunting and fire use by Neanderthals and Mesolithic hunter-gatherers reshaped forests and grasslands in measurable ways. By reducing populations of giant herbivores, people indirectly altered h

articles.title: Police identify 18-year-old as suspect in Tumbler Ridge shooting
articles.description: A candlelit vigil was held on Wednesday night in the remote British Columbia town where six people were killed and dozens injured.

articles.title: 'One in a billion': Dawson's Creek stars lead tributes to James Van Der Beek
articles.description: Katie Holmes pays tribute to her late co-star's "bravery, compassion, selflessness and strength".

articles.title: Now is the time Ottawa gets behind high-speed rail | Opinion
articles.description: Mohammed Adam: Will it be expensive? Yes. But sometimes you can’t put monetary value on nation-building.

articles.title: Committee rejects 'impossible standard' for heritage designation
articles.description: The current threshold is 25 per cent of buildings that must meet at least two of the province's nine criteria for heritage designation.

articles.title: Father of Alberta school shooting victim talks grieving and forgiveness
articles.description: The father of a student killed in a school shooting in southern Alberta almost 27 years ago says forgiveness was at the heart of how he tackled the tragedy. Retired reverend Dale Lang lost his 17-year-old son, Jason, after the teen was shot by a fellow student in a hallway at W.R. Myers High School

articles.title: What to expect on the commute when four-day return-to-office begins
articles.description: Traffic congestion could worsen with four days in office weekly for federal public servants, observers say, and there are still questions about OC Transpo's ability to handle the heavier workload.

articles.title: Businessman Frank Stronach’s Toronto sex assault trial set to begin after delay
articles.description: The sexual assault trial of Canadian auto parts magnate Frank Stronach is set to begin in Toronto today after more than a week of delay. articles.title: Yellowstone wolves may not have transformed the national park after all
articles.description: A new scientific review challenges the headline-grabbing claim that Yellowstone’s returning wolves triggered one of the strongest trophic cascades on Earth. Researchers found that the reported 1,500% surge in willow growth was based on circular calculations and questionable comparisons. After correc

articles.title: Astronomers discover an Earth-like planet that may be colder than Mars
articles.description: A newly identified planet candidate, HD 137010 b, looks strikingly Earth-like in size and orbit — but it may be colder than Mars due to its dimmer star. If it has a thick enough atmosphere, though, this icy world could still surprise us.

articles.title: NASA scientists say meteorites can’t explain mysterious organic compounds on Mars
articles.description: Scientists studying a rock sample collected by NASA’s Curiosity rover have uncovered something tantalizing: the largest organic molecules ever detected on Mars. articles.title: Downtown respite site to close next month due to FIFA World Cup preparations
articles.description: As Toronto prepares to host FIFA World Cup matches in June, those using a longstanding shelter just steps from the stadium will soon have to find a new place to stay warm.
